    Projects

    • Speech Controlled Robot

      Turned a Line Tracer Robot into voice controlled robot using Raspberry Pi and Google Speech API.

    • IoT Aqua

      Won 2nd runner up at Intel IoT Hackathon, Pune(2015) for making a prototype of smart aquarium using Intel Edison which maintains optimum level of oxygen,temperature and light intensity in the tank and sending these parameters to the owner on his mobile/computer or any other MQTT enabled device.

    • Galileo Link

      A hobby project which is an IoT implementation. It connects my room to facebook . The updates from my room are posted on Facebook. This is Python and Facebool Graph API based project that runs on Intel Galileo Gen 2.

    • IBM Bluemix IoT Service with Python

      Publishing and visualising CPU utilisation data on IBM Bluemix cloud service using MQTT.

    • Mail-Checker

      An email notifier using Intel Galileo Gen2 Board running Python Script that used IMAPClient to check unread mails and turn ON the LED and turns it OFF when there are no unread emails.

    • Wearable Electronics

      A glove that held a device made of MSP430 (low power uC) and a HC-05 bluetooth module that was used to send commands to a bluetooth interfaced music player which played .wav files stored on the microSD card .

    • Door Defender

      Automatic visitor/intruder detection system using Beaglebone Black. The device clicks the photograph of the visitor and records the voice message and sends it to the house owner’s Gmail account.The protocol used is SMTP.

    • E-Lamp

      An electronic inauguration lamp based on low power MSP430 microcontroller that works just like a traditional inauguration lamp.

    • Voltage Regulator and Wireless Control

      An arduino based voltage regulator that has been used to control the speed of a fan(230V/50Hz). The voltage control is done by triac ,optocoupler and the arduino. This was further interfaced with RC remote and Mobile phone enabling wireless control of the device.
